attributes.action: British Overseas Territories must be allowed to negotiate with the EU directly
attributes.additional_details: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. Following the UK vote to leave the EU, all Overseas Territories, who had no opportunity to vote, require the ability to negotiate with the EU without restriction from the UK.
attributes.background: British Overseas Territories benefit from a special relationship with the European Union allowing freedom of movement, international investment and direct EU financial input. There was no opportunity for Territories to vote in the referendum and the decision by the UK will impact them.
